ITALIAN WINES

Many wine drinkers are now turning to Italy to provide good wine at modest cost. We have taken the challenge seriously, and have searched out the best that Italy has to offer. We particularly commend the litres and double-litres as among the best values in good red and white wine for the money—the

Ghemme, for a glorious, big red—and the Soave, for your daily warm weather wine.

SHERRIES FROM SPAIN

‘Sherry-on-the-Rocks’ has now become in vogue on the conti- nent. This habit is now being adopted in America—particularly by those who prefer an aperitif of lower alcoholic content, especially during the Summer.

1229 MANZANILLA “LA GITANA”........... 3.19 35.59 Crisp, bone-dry—serve icy cold as they do in Spain. 1238 CARRASCAL CREAM (Rivero).......... 4.49 48.50 Rich in age and character; medium dry, dramatically luxurious.
